revised_title: Subterranean Trees and the Effects of Mad Dog Bites
tldr: The author shares two letters discussing the existence of subterranean trees in levels and the effects of mad dog bites. He provides accounts of people who were bitten by rabid dogs and the symptoms they experienced, including severe headaches, fever, and madness. The author also mentions the history of forests in the area and the impact of the Roman conquest on the environment.
sub_discipline: Rabies and its effects on humans
